description:
Rear Garden:
T1: Mature Pittosporum:  Approximately 7.00m:  Raise low crown by approximately 1.25m.  Lightly thin density by 15%-20%. Trim to tidy and control, up to approximately 30cm. Remove dead wood. General maintenance.
T2: Mature Apple: Approximately 5.00m: Reduce back to previous and most recent reduction points approximately 1.20m. Reduce western section of the crown by up to 1.50m to help balance and reduce back from the Camphor tree adjacent. To help control encroachment. General maintenance.
Naturalised area/rear of the garden:
G1: Pyracantha Hedge Line: Approximately 3.50m-4.00m:  Reduce hedge height by approximately 1.25m-1.50m. Reduce lateral and sub lateral growth back from the garden to control encroachment up to 70cm. General maintenance.
T3: Camphor Laurel: Approximately 5.00m: Reduce crown by approximately 1.25m all round to form a more compact crown structure.  Thin crown density by 20%. General maintenance.
S1: Viburnum: multi stemmed: Approximately 3.50m: Reduce by approximately 0.50m.  Lightly thin crown density by 15%-20%. Preserve epicormic and Basel growth. General maintenance.
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
